title.narrative: SOCIAL NORMS TO ADDRESS VAC, NEGLECT, DISCRIMINTAION

description.narrative: Parents, caregivers and children are equipped with increased knowledge on violence against children and positive parenting and with skills to respond to violence, neglect, abuse and discrimination., which contributes to Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Private Sector Engagement, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, especially the most vulnerable, are protected from all forms of violence, abuse, neglect and abject poverty and increasingly utilize quality, integrated social protection services, and parents and caregivers change their attitudes and behaviours on violence against children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Parents, caregivers and children are equipped with increased knowledge on violence against children and positive parenting and withskills to respond to violence, neglect, abuse and discrimination.

description.narrative: The joint work of national stakeholders and UNICEF contributed to a decrease in the proportion of adults and specialists who support corporal punishment and an increase of the proportion of adults who apply a positive parenting approach in target regions.The UNICEF campaign to prevent VAC has potentially reached over 4 million persons online. Special attention was given to capacity building of the media and specialists in target regions. UNICEF developed and disseminated 14 video communication products, parenting brochures and launched a special media project. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2022
